economy_summary: Today's financial landscape was marked by a blend of domestic policy initiatives, significant international monetary policy discussions, and notable movements in tech and commodity markets. Domestically, China's National Development and Reform Commission reiterated its commitment to stimulating consumption through "practical and innovative measures," aiming to curb "involutionary" competition and foster new growth. This sentiment was echoed by the Ministry of Finance's announcement to leverage government bond funds, including the issuance of ultra-long special treasury bonds, to stabilize investment and reverse its downward trend. These measures signal a proactive stance by Beijing to underpin economic growth, with Guangdong's AI core industry already reaching a significant 220 billion yuan scale, further demonstrating regional economic dynamism. Shenzhen also advanced green finance with its first green foreign debt pilot businesses. On the corporate front, major state-owned banks began distributing over 200 billion yuan in 2025 mid-term dividends, injecting liquidity and confidence into the market, while news of Vanke's three debt extension proposals being rejected by bondholders highlighted ongoing challenges in the real estate sector, despite a 5-working-day grace period. Internationally, the "Super Central Bank Week" saw Japan initiating rate hikes, marking a potential end to the easing cycle for many developed nations. This raises critical questions about the US Federal Reserve's path for next year, with speculation about the Fed potentially cutting rates "alone." The ongoing race for the next Fed Chair intensified, with "Cosmic Bank" CEO's support for Kevin Warsh leading to a surge in his prediction market probability. Former President Trump also weighed in, stating his preference for Warsh or Glenn Hassett and asserting that the Fed Chair should consult him on interest rates, even suggesting a target of 1% or lower within a year. These comments inject a degree of political uncertainty into future monetary policy. Wall Street investment banks issued a cautionary outlook for 2026, warning that a market crash could trigger a US recession, reversing the usual cause-and-effect. US bank deposits also saw a slight contraction, falling from $18.528 trillion to $18.479 trillion in the prior week. Technology and commodity markets also saw significant action. OpenAI's GPT-5.2 reportedly received widespread negative reviews within 24 hours of its launch, indicating potential setbacks for the AI giant. In contrast, Yushu Robotics launched a humanoid robot App Store, aiming to create a smartphone-like ecosystem for complex robot actions, and Disney committed $1 billion to an OpenAI partnership, leveraging 200 IPs and Sora technology. Space exploration garnered attention with SpaceX's internal IPO pricing at $421 per share, valuing the company at $800 billion, while China's Zhuque-3 rocket experienced an abnormal combustion, failing its soft landing. In commodities, gold continued its rapid surge in 2025 as a safe haven, and platinum saw an impressive 80% price increase this year, being dubbed a "gold alternative." The Moutai price also jumped by 150 yuan in the grey market following rumors of supply controls, indicating strong demand for luxury goods. However, broader US tech stocks experienced a downturn, with Broadcom shares plummeting over 11% following its earnings report, contributing to Nasdaq and S&P 500 falling over 1%. The general market sentiment appears mixed, with optimism around specific sectors like AI and green finance balanced by concerns over real estate stability, global monetary policy shifts, and potential market risks highlighted by investment banks. Funds appear to be flowing into strategic infrastructure, green initiatives, and specific growth industries like robotics and AI applications, while showing caution in broader equity markets especially after earnings reports.

items.title: GPT-5.2 Launch Receives Widespread Negative Reviews
items.summary: OpenAI's GPT-5.2, launched 24 hours ago, is reportedly receiving widespread negative reviews, signaling potential challenges in its initial adoption and market reception.

items.title: National Development and Reform Commission: Boost Consumption with New Measures and Address 'Involutionary' Competition
items.summary: China's National Development and Reform Commission announced plans to implement practical and innovative measures to boost consumption, alongside efforts to address 'involutionary' competition and cultivate new economic growth engines.

items.title: Yushu Robotics Launches Humanoid Robot App Store, Emulating Smartphone Ecosystem
items.summary: Yushu Robotics has launched a humanoid robot App Store, mirroring the smartphone ecosystem, which enables complex actions to be 'downloaded and used immediately,' potentially transforming robot interaction.

items.title: President Xi Jinping: 'Choking-point' Restrictions Will Not Work on Us
items.summary: President Xi Jinping declared that 'practice has proven that 'choking-point' restrictions cannot stop us,' referring to international efforts to limit China's access to critical technologies.

items.title: Vanke's Three Debt Extension Proposals Rejected by Bondholders
items.summary: Vanke's three debt extension proposals were not approved by bondholders, though the company retains a 5-working-day grace period to address the issue.

items.title: Ministry of Finance: Utilize Government Bonds, Issue Ultra-Long Special Treasury Bonds to Stabilize Investment
items.summary: China's Ministry of Finance stated its intention to fully leverage government bond funds, including issuing ultra-long special treasury bonds, to stabilize investment and reverse its downward trend.

items.title: Fu Peng on 2026 Market Theme: US Bond Yield Curve and Three Possibilities for AI Application
items.impact: Global Macro, AI Sector, Bond Market
items.summary: Financial analyst Fu Peng projects the US bond yield curve and three potential outcomes for AI application implementation as the primary market focus for 2026.

items.title: 'Cosmic Bank' CEO Supports Warsh for Fed Chair, Probability Skyrockets in Prediction Markets
items.impact: US Monetary Policy, International Finance, Fed Chair Race
items.summary: Following the 'Cosmic Bank' CEO's endorsement, Kevin Warsh's probability of becoming the next Fed Chair has sharply increased in prediction markets, indicating growing confidence.

items.title: US Treasury to 'Merge' with Federal Reserve? Bessent Named 'Shadow Fed Chair'
items.summary: Amidst rumors of a potential 'merger' between the US Treasury and the Federal Reserve, speculative reports are naming Bessent as the 'shadow Fed Chair,' implying significant shifts in financial governance.

items.title: Zhuque-3 Recovery Rocket Fails Soft Landing Due to Abnormal Combustion Miles Above Ground
items.summary: The Zhuque-3 recovery verification rocket failed its soft landing due to abnormal combustion during its final engine ignition, several kilometers above the ground, leading to its inability to complete the maneuver.

items.title: Wall Street Investment Banks: 2026 Risk is Market Crash Leading to US Recession, Not Vice Versa
items.summary: Wall Street investment banks caution that for 2026, the primary risk is a market collapse causing a US recession, rather than a recession leading to a market crash.

items.title: Super Central Bank Week: Japan Leads Rate Hikes, Developed Nations' Easing Ends, Will Fed Cut Alone?
items.summary: During a 'Super Central Bank Week,' Japan led with interest rate hikes, signaling the end of the easing cycle for many developed countries, prompting questions about a potential 'solo' rate cut by the US Federal Reserve next year.

items.title: Oracle, Broadcom Earnings: Higher Expectations Lead to Sharper Sell-offs
items.impact: Tech Stocks, Chip Sector, Broadcom, Oracle
items.summary: Oracle and Broadcom's earnings revealed that high market expectations resulted in amplified sell-offs, with Broadcom's stock plummeting over 11% post-announcement.

items.title: 'AI+' and 'Three New Economies' Replace Real Estate as Economic Engine, 'Jobless Growth' in Focus
items.impact: Chinese Economy, AI Sector, Real Estate, Labor Market
items.summary: With 'AI+' and the 'three new economies' becoming the new economic engines over real estate, concerns are rising about 'jobless growth' becoming a focal point in the economy.

items.title: US Bank Deposits Fell to $18.479 Trillion from $18.528 Trillion in Prior Week
items.summary: US bank deposits saw a decline, dropping to $18.479 trillion from $18.528 trillion in the preceding week, indicating a slight contraction in the banking system's liquidity.

items.title: 'Unethical' Game: Commodity Market's 'Squeeze' Frenzy
items.summary: A 'squeeze' frenzy is gripping commodity markets, described as an 'unethical' game, highlighting intense and potentially manipulative trading conditions.

items.title: SpaceX Internal IPO Pricing Revealed: $421 Per Share, Valuing Company at $800 Billion
items.impact: Space Industry, Private Equity, IPO Market
items.summary: SpaceX's internal IPO pricing has been disclosed at $421 per share, giving the company an estimated valuation of $800 billion.

items.title: Disney Commits $1 Billion to OpenAI Partnership: 200 IPs + Sora for Takeoff?
items.summary: Disney is reportedly investing $1 billion to partner with OpenAI, planning to integrate its 200 IPs with Sora technology, a move expected to significantly boost its content creation capabilities.

items.title: 'World Model' Competition Escalates: Runway Launches GWM-1, Real-time Interaction for Several Minutes
items.summary: The 'world model' competition is escalating with Runway's launch of GWM-1, which offers real-time interactive capabilities sustainable for several minutes, pushing the boundaries of generative AI.

items.title: Visa Executive: 2026 Will Be 'Year One of AI Shopping Assistants'
items.summary: According to a Visa executive, 2026 is anticipated to be the 'Year One of AI shopping assistants,' forecasting a transformative period for retail and consumer interaction through AI technology.

items.title: Movie 'Zootopia 2' Box Office Exceeds 3.5 Billion in 19 Days
items.summary: The movie 'Zootopia 2' has achieved a significant box office milestone, accumulating over 3.5 billion RMB in total revenue within 19 days of its theatrical release.

items.title: Japan Faces Severe Problem of Drug Abuse Among Middle School Students
items.summary: A recent survey indicates a severe and widespread problem of drug abuse among middle school students across Japan, raising significant social concerns.

items.title: Washington State Experiences Widespread Flooding, More Severe Disasters Expected
items.summary: Washington State is grappling with widespread flooding, and authorities are warning that the region could face even more severe natural disasters in the upcoming period.

items.title: Hong Kong and India Propel Asian Financing to a Record Year
items.summary: China Hong Kong and India have significantly contributed to Asia's financial sector, leading to a record-breaking year for financing across the region.

items.title: Suzhou Wujiang Forecasts Over 7,000 Births in 2025
items.summary: The Wujiang district of Suzhou is predicted to record more than 7,000 births in 2025, providing insights into local demographic trends.

items.title: Guangdong AI Core Industry Reaches 220 Billion Yuan Scale
items.summary: Guangdong's core artificial intelligence industry has expanded to a significant scale of 220 billion yuan, underscoring the province's strong position in the AI sector.

items.title: Shenzhen's First Batch of Green Foreign Debt Pilot Businesses Landed
items.summary: Shenzhen has implemented its inaugural pilot program for green foreign debt, marking a new step in sustainable financing within its capital markets.

items.title: Moutai Price Rises, Yellow Market Sees Jump of 150 Yuan for Feitian Moutai After Supply Control Rumors
items.summary: Moutai's price has risen, and the grey market saw Feitian Moutai jump by 150 yuan in some areas after news of supply quantity controls circulated, indicating strong demand.

items.title: Six State-Owned Banks Begin 2025 Mid-Term Dividend Payouts Totaling Over 200 Billion Yuan
items.summary: Six major state-owned banks have initiated their 2025 mid-term dividend payouts, with the total amount distributed exceeding 200 billion yuan, signaling financial stability in the banking sector.

items.title: Poyang Lake Drops Below Extremely Low Water Level, Connecting Water Area Reduced by 90%
items.summary: Poyang Lake has reached an extremely low water level, with its connecting water area decreasing by 90%, highlighting significant environmental concerns.

items.title: Trump Leaning Towards Warsh or Hassett for Fed Chair, Wants Consultation on Rates
items.impact: US Monetary Policy, Political Risk, Fed Chair Race
items.summary: Donald Trump indicated his preference for Kevin Warsh or Glenn Hassett as the next Fed Chair, asserting that the Fed Chair should consult him on interest rates, proposing a target of 1% or lower within a year.

items.title: American Military Personnel Attacked in Syria, Trump Vows Retaliation
items.summary: Three US personnel were killed in an attack in Syria, prompting former President Trump to promise retaliation, escalating geopolitical tensions in the region.

items.title: Morgan Stanley: If Recession Hits, US Stocks Could Quickly Drop 20%
items.summary: Morgan Stanley cautioned that the US stock market could experience a swift 20% decline if an economic recession were to materialize, signaling significant downside risk.

items.title: Gold Surges in 2025: A Safe Haven Amidst Global Uncertainty
items.summary: Gold has seen a rapid surge in 2025, reinforcing its status as a critical safe-haven asset for investors amid heightened global uncertainty.

items.title: Platinum Rallies 80% This Year, Dubbed 'Gold Alternative'
items.summary: Platinum prices have soared by 80% this year, leading to its recognition as a 'gold alternative' and highlighting a significant re-evaluation of its market value.

items.title: US Regulatory Shift: SEC & OCC Open Doors for Real Asset Tokenization & Crypto Banks
items.summary: US regulators, including the SEC and OCC, are reportedly opening avenues for the tokenization of real assets and the development of crypto banks, signaling a notable shift in policy towards digital finance.

items.title: '15th Five-Year Plan' Kicks Off New Energy Powerhouse Phase: Hydrogen & Nuclear Energy Key
items.impact: Energy Sector, Clean Energy, Chinese Economy
items.summary: China's '15th Five-Year Plan' is ushering in a new era for its energy sector, with hydrogen and nuclear power designated as key elements for building an energy superpower.

items.title: Morgan Stanley Warns of 20% US Stock Drop if Recession Hits
items.summary: A prominent investment bank, Morgan Stanley, warned that US stocks could rapidly decline by 20% if an economic recession occurs, urging caution for investors.
